channel.title: CNN.com - Top Stories
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2014 Cable News Network LP, LLLP.

image.title: CNN.com - Top Stories
image.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

item.title: Graham hits Benghazi report
item.description: Sen. Lindsey Graham says it's "garbage" that the report finds no members of the Obama administration lied to cover up what happened the night of a deadly attack in Benghazi.

item.title: Bird flu worries spread in Europe
item.description: Europeans are worried about a possible continent-wide bird flu epidemic after a wild duck tested positive for the H5N8 virus in northeast Germany, authorities said.

item.title: 'SNL' skit: Obama is Capitol bully
item.description: You sure gotta climb a lot of steps to reach the Capitol building in Washington, so just imagine what the tumble down is like.

item.title: Should this family lose its pit bull?
item.description: A Louisiana family is fighting to protect its beloved pit bull from a "vicious dogs" ordinance.

item.title: UVA suspends all fraternities
item.description: The University of Virginia is suspending all fraternities and associated parties until January 9 following a Rolling Stone magazine article that described a student's account of being gang raped and her frustration at trying to bring her alleged attackers to accountability.

item.title: Giffords finishes 11-mile bike ride
item.description: Former Arizona Rep. Gabby Giffords completed an 11-mile cycling event Saturday, marking another milestone in her recovery from a 2011 mass shooting.

item.title: Ex-DC Mayor Marion Barry dies at 78
item.description: Dogged by allegations of drug and alcohol abuse during his first three mayoral terms, Marion Barry was elected four times as the city's chief executive and was a council member for Washington's 8th ward at the time of his death.

item.title: Students slam first lady over lunches
item.description: Students unhappy with school meals are taking it out on the first lady by sharing images on social media of lunches sarcastically tagged #ThanksMichelleObama.

item.title: Female sex desire: It's complicated
item.description: What makes a woman want to have sex isn't totally hormonal, as it can be with men. Happiness is key new study shows.

item.title: Two country singers come out as gay
item.description: There are plenty of country songs about how to be a man. One way is to face the music, and two country crooners did that on Thursday.

item.title: Russia: West wants regime change
item.description: With tensions simmering over the deadly crisis in Ukraine, Russia has accused the West of seeking regime change in Moscow, prompting renewed comparisons with the Cold War era.

item.title: More Cosby accusers come forward
item.description: At least three more women have come forward with allegations of sexual misconduct by Bill Cosby, joining 10 others.

item.title: Celebs brought down by scandal
item.description: Bill Cosby is just the latest star whose reputation has been tarnished by scandal. CNN's Dan Simon explains.

item.title: New Beyonce video rocks the Web
item.description: Social media is all abuzz with the latest video from the Queen B herself -- Beyonce.

item.title: 'Black Widow' has five dead lovers
item.description: Police in Japan are questioning a wealthy widow about the mysterious deaths of her past partners.

item.title: Website streams private webcams
item.description: A Russian website is streaming video from private webcams around the world. Laurie Segall reports.

item.title: U.S. may extend Iran nuclear talks
item.description: International negotiators in Vienna are scrambling to reach a deal on Iran's nuclear program, with media in Tehran suggesting a comprehensive agreement by Monday's deadline is "impossible."

item.title: Obama golfs with Jeter in Vegas
item.description: President Obama has traded GOP rancor and late-fall temperatures in Washington for a golf outing with Derek Jeter at the nicest golf resort in Las Vegas.

item.title: Police recruits tested for virginity
item.description: The Indonesian police use an invasive test to check for female recruits' virginity, a Human Rights Watch report claims.

item.title: Kids with cancer fighting back
item.description: After witnessing the pain and fear that children with cancer endure, Rabbi Elimelech Goldberg founded a program that provides free martial arts classes so kids can learn to control their pain and feel powerful.

item.title: He ate 9 lbs. of turkey in 10 minutes
item.description: Just in time for Thanksgiving, Joey Chestnut sets a world record at the World Turkey Eating Championships.

item.title: Say buh-bye to seat-back screens
item.description: Rachel Crane investigates airlines' newest cost-cutting measure.

item.title: Obama responds to heckler
item.description: During his immigration speech at Del Sol High School in Las Vegas, President Obama addresses a heckler in the crowd.

item.title: CNN Hero of the Year is ...
item.description: Pen Farthing, who founded a nonprofit that reunites soldiers at home with stray dogs and cats they took in during combat, has been named the 2014 CNN Hero of the Year.

item.title: Top 5 most dangerous jobs
item.description: Alexandra Field lists 5 of the most dangerous jobs in America.

item.title: U.S. tracking mystery spacecraft
item.description: CNN's Chad Myers reports on a Russian object in space on a mission that remains unclear to the U.S.

item.title: Not clear if cops knew it wasn't real
item.description: A Cleveland police officer responding to a call about a person with a gun fatally wounded a 12-year-old boy brandishing what turned out to be an air gun, police said.

item.title: 12-year-old killed by cops
item.description: A 12-year-old in Ohio was killed by police after an incident involving an air gun. CNN's Sara Ganim reports.

item.title: N.Y. cop 'accidentally' kills man
item.description: A rookie police officer shot and killed an unarmed 28-year-old man in an unlit stairwell of a housing project in what New York's top cop said Friday was "a very unfortunate tragedy ... involving an accidental discharge."

item.title: The big 'Hunger Games' lesson
item.description: Van Jones says the Hunger Games is a more sweeping critique of wealth inequality than Elizabeth Warren's speech

item.title: When white people riot
item.description: When black people protest against police violence in Ferguson, Missouri, they're thought of as a "mob."

item.title: The forgotten Cosby claims victim
item.description: Blue Telusma says the entertainer's wife has charted her own career and has remained stoic amid the allegations about Bill Cosby

item.title: Why Jerusalem is so explosive
item.description: Even back when you could still use the term "peace process" with a straight face, the odds of solving the Jerusalem issue were pretty long. But things are even worse now, says Aaron David Miller.

item.title: She's playing Super Bowl halftime
item.description: Get ready to hear that voice, hear that sound -- like thunder gonna shake the ground.

item.title: Attack kills 45 at volleyball game
item.description: At least 45 people were killed and 60 others were wounded Sunday after a suicide bomber attacked a crowd watching a volleyball match in the Yahyakhil district of Afghanistan's southeastern Paktika province, according to a spokesman for Paktika Governor Mukhlis Afghan.

item.title: See U.S. Navy's drone-killing laser
item.description: The U.S. Navy is deploying a secret weapon to the Persian Gulf: A laser cannon that can bring down drones and ships.

item.title: What happens when 7 feet of snow melt
item.description: What's worse than 7 feet of snow piled up in front of your house? How about the flooding that comes once those 7 feet of snow melt?

item.title: Drone's stunning view of snow
item.description: James Grimaldi used a drone to capture footage after a massive amount of snow had fallen in West Seneca, New York.

item.title: China building island in disputed waters
item.description: China is building an island in the South China Sea that could accommodate the country's first airstrip in bitterly contested waters, according to satellite images analyzed by Jane's Defence Weekly.

item.title: Obama: Voters want to trade me in
item.description: President Obama said in an interview Sunday that he has some "dings" but will help his party during the 2016 election cycle in any way he can.

item.title: ISIS, Iraqi forces battle in Ramadi
item.description: A fierce battle between ISIS militants and Iraqi military and tribal forces is raging close to the main government complex of Anbar province in the center of Ramadi, the capital city.

item.title: Banker to stand trial over brutal killings
item.description: A court in Hong Kong has ruled that a British banker charged with the grisly murder of two Indonesian women is psychologically fit to enter a plea on both counts.

item.title: How did Bill Cosby get here?
item.description: Bill Cosby has dominated headlines for much of the last month as accusations of sexual assault pile up.

item.title: A shocking find in a storm drain
item.description: The bicyclists were on a morning ride Sunday when they heard a shocking sound coming from somewhere below them: a baby crying.

item.title: Do shrimp hold clues to alien life?
item.description: Shrimp crawling around rock chimneys spewing hot water deep in the Caribbean Sea may hold clues to the kinds of life that can thrive in extreme environments on other planets, NASA says.

item.title: 6-year-old a future Formula 1 star?
item.description: John Defterios meets Rashid Al Dhaheri, a precocious 6-year-old who has his sights set on becoming a Formula 1 racer.

item.title: Your Thanksgiving do-ahead list
item.description: Our goal is to send you into Thanksgiving with a confident smile on your face, and seeing you emerge on the other side with your sanity intact. It can happen.

item.title: 20 years of Tofurky: Why fake meat?
item.description: Options for meat substitutes have come a long way since Seth Tibbott's first few Thanksgivings as vegetarian in the 1970s.

item.title: Here's to a cheesy Thanksgiving
item.description: It's no wonder the holidays and macaroni and cheese go together so well: They're both warm, comforting and filled with more than their share of cheesy moments.

item.title: Ellsberg: He's a hero
item.description: Daniel Ellsberg tells CNN's Don Lemon that NSA leaker Edward Snowden showed courage, has done an enormous service.

item.title: Bizarre-looking fish gets closeup
item.description: Does this bizarre-looking fish look familiar to you?

item.title: The week in 34 photos
item.description: People in Nicaragua tried to save a stranded whale, a plane crashed into a house, protesters egged a European leader and Santa Claus went surfing.

item.title: THIS animal attacks, traps man in home
item.description: A groundhog attacked, then chased a man into his house in New Hampshire. CNN affiliate WBZ reports.

item.title: City to ban wheeled suitcases
item.description: For years Venice has battled the effects of rising waters on its historic architecture, but now it's facing a new threat -- wheeled suitcases.

item.title: Man gets help after botched surgery
item.description: A Costa Rican tour guide gets reconstructive surgery after driving 800 miles to return a hearing aid. KPHO has more.

item.title: Meet the future Mrs. Charles Manson
item.description: CNN's Ted Rowlands speaks with Afton "Star" Burton, a woman poised to become the future Mrs. Charles Manson.

item.title:
Stars shine on
AMA red carpet
item.description: See what stars such as R5, Sam Smith, One Direction, Jordin Sparks, Taylor Swift, Meghan Trainor, Fergie and Mary J. Blige wore on the red carpet.

item.title: 'Landfill dogs' face sad reality
item.description: Homeless and ownerless, these shelter dogs could end up buried in the very landfill they are playing on.

item.title: The video Cosby didn't want public
item.description: The AP released an interview with Bill Cosby from Nov. 6 in which he refuses to comment on rape allegations against him.

item.title: World's best metro stations
item.description: These quirky and beautiful subway stops make commuting look fun.

item.title: 'Orange' actress: They deported my family
item.description: Actress Diane Guerrero speaks about her family's deportation from the U.S. to Colombia when she was 14 years old.

item.title: Dog's weird habit makes owner laugh
item.description: Unhinged by doorways, pit bull enters BACKWARDS. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports on the butt-first way Queso conquers his fear.

item.title: 'Shawshank' stars reunite
item.description: Believe it or not, it's been 20 years since Morgan Freeman and Tim Robbins had that epic reunion in "The Shawshank Redemption."

item.title: Bizarre finds in abandoned nightclubs
item.description: Italian photographer Antonio La Grotta has captured the decaying splendor -- and stumbled on a number of strange discoveries -- in abandoned nightclubs.

item.title: Can you guess who this actress is?
item.description: CNN's Brooke Baldwin takes a look back into the early days of how actress Jennifer Lawrence got her start.

item.title: Flip phones are hip again
item.description: Hipsters, rejoice. Next time you ride your fixed-gear bicycle to the the thrift store, where you find a vintage, grease-stained mechanic's shirt that matches your Rollie Fingers mustache and Grizzly Adams beard, there's an edgy, if technologically sub-optimal, way to tell your friends about it.

item.title: Yikes! This happened on live TV
item.description: A reporter for Australia's Seven Network learned the hazards of live TV while reporting next to a skatepark in the U.S..

item.title: Britney Spears reads 'mean tweet'
item.description: Britney Spears and John Stamos were just a few of the celebrities that read mean tweets on "Jimmy Kimmel Live."

item.title:
Praying for an answer
-- and for peace
item.description: At a Sunday service, Ferguson churchgoers seek solace after the protests in their city, which remains on edge as it awaits word on a grand jury decision in the case of a police officer who killed an unarmed man.

item.title: American Music Awards 2014: Red Carpet
The week in 34 photos

Praying for an answer
-- and for peace
item.description: At a Sunday service, Ferguson churchgoers seek solace after the protests in their city, which remains on edge as it awaits word on a grand jury decision in the case of a police officer who killed an unarmed man.

item.title: Is Ferguson grand jury close to deciding?
item.description: A grand jury will reconvene Monday to continue weighing evidence in its investigation of the Michael Brown shooting.

item.title: Cops: Woman shot with gun for crisis
item.description: A woman appears to have accidentally fatally shot herself in the head with a gun bought to prepare for possible Ferguson-related unrest, according to sources briefed on the police investigation.

item.title: CNN host, protester's fiery talk
item.description: CNN's Michael Smerconish spoke with Bassem Masri about the escalating protests in Ferguson, Missouri.

item.title: Giuliani: Ferguson is exception
item.description: Former New York City Mayor Rudy Giuliani says the controversy surrounding the death of 18-year-old Michael Brown, who was fatally shot by a white police officer in Ferguson, Missouri, does not exemplify a larger national problem.

item.title: Cold weather
item.description: What's worse than 7 feet of snow piled up in front of your house? How about the flooding that comes once those 7 feet of snow melt?

item.title: Iran nuclear talks
item.description: The United States might extend a deadline to reach a comprehensive agreement on Iran's nuclear program, a senior State Department official told CNN.

item.title: Ferguson
item.description: A grand jury will reconvene Monday to continue weighing evidence in its investigation of the Michael Brown shooting.

item.title: Police shooting
item.description: A Cleveland police officer responding to a call about a person with a gun fatally wounded a 12-year-old boy brandishing what turned out to be an air gun that looked very much like a real firearm, police said early Sunday.

item.title: Obama
item.description: President Obama said in an interview Sunday that he has some "dings" but will help his party during the 2016 election cycle in any way he can.

item.title: Bill Cosby
item.description: Bill Cosby has dominated headlines for much of the last month as accusations of sexual assault pile up.

item.title: Super Bowl
item.description: Get ready to hear that voice, hear that sound -- like thunder gonna shake the ground.

item.title: Thanksgiving
item.description: Our goal is to send you into Thanksgiving with a confident smile on your face, and seeing you emerge on the other side with your sanity intact. It can happen.

item.title: Radio helps Rwanda heal
item.description: Romance. Suspense. Good versus evil. On the surface, Rwandan radio soap opera "Musekeweya," or "New Dawn," feels familiar. Like a Rwandan "Romeo and Juliet," it tells the story of lovers from two different villages at odds with each other.

item.title: The week in 34 photos
Hermits of Ukraine, Russia
item.description: Deep in the untouched areas of Ukraine and Russia live men who have decided to leave human establishments and live isolated in nature.

item.title: Look at me! 25 selfies of the week
Kobani: Life at war
item.description: At the edge of the Syrian war, photographer Furkan Temir found despair packed in tent camps and an outpouring of humanity from a tight-knit Turkish border community.

item.title: What a shot! 39 sports photos
